meanings.definition: A device used for counting or calculating, consisting of a frame with rows of wires or grooves along which beads are slid.
meanings.sent1: At school, we used an abacas to help us with our math homework.
meanings.sent2: The merchant used an abacas to keep track of his inventory.
meanings.sent3: The abacas at the store seemed to have a mind of its own, always giving the wrong answers.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked like an abacas, swiftly calculating the numbers without hesitation.
meanings.sent5: The shiny abacas gleamed in the sunlight, a tool of precision and accuracy.

meanings.definition: A calculating tool used in ancient times, typically consisting of a frame with rods or wires on which beads are moved.
meanings.sent1: Archaeologists discovered an ancient abacas buried in the ruins.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed a collection of ancient abacas from different civilizations.
meanings.sent3: The abacas in the history book looked like a strange contraption to the modern student.
meanings.sent4: His mind was like an abacas, each thought a bead moving along the wires of his consciousness.
meanings.sent5: The ancient abacas whispered stories of long-forgotten calculations and trade agreements.
